title: Never give up as Teemo (Carrying from behind)

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
I played like complete ass. 0-5 by the 10 minute mark, feeding multiple lanes. Talon was doing similarly poor, but had good cs. 

Our jungler was securing objectives very well, along with me abondoning lane by 15 minutes to set up drag and baron with shrooms.

Bot was doing ok.


We got destroyed early game. Completely one sided for 20 minutes. We snuck a first dragon but lost the ensuing fight, and Trundle flash smited the second dragon, so we still had dragon control.

Later in the game we decided to sneak a 4 man baron while the enemy team pushed bot hard. We got baron, they got the inhib. (Still completely behind)

I spent the next 20 minutes shrooming up near the choke points of the inhib tower, where I expected the fights to occur.

Finally, near the end of the game, I stealthed in the middle of the lane. They managed to hit *all 4* of my shrooms I set up 6 minutes ago as a team. I uncloaked and sniped Kalista, we counterengaged. Completely won the late game for my team, while Trundle kept us in the early-mid game by securing objectives.

Never give up if you can read the game correctly, especially as a setup champion. (Shen, Teemo, Shaco, Rek'Sai, Pantheon, etc.)
